name: jmaintenance
tagline: System recovery application for Debian GNU/Linux
body:
### About jmaintenance is a system recovery program that tries to fix common errors which might keep the system from booting. This program is for Debian GNU/Linux systems (tested on Wheezy 7.5, but other versions might work as well); do not use it on other distributions! ### About project This program is written for the JackOS Project, a Debian based, innovative GNU/Linux distribution. ### License This is free and open source software, released under GPL version 2. See LICENSE for more information. Copyright (C) 2014 Peter Simon. ### Current status jmaintenance is tested a lot, but it is still not ready for production systems. Currently it's in beta stage. You can help improve it by testing jmaintenance and reporting any bugs you find. ### Documentation The program is documented in its manual page, jmaintenance(8) (you can find it under `doc/jmaintenance.8`). More information is available on our [wiki](https://github.com/ptrsimon/jmaintenance/wiki). ### Installation For installation instructions, see `doc/INSTALL` or the relevant [wiki page](https://github.com/ptrsimon/jmaintenance/wiki/Information-for-users#installation). ### Authors Author: Peter Simon
Contributors: Michael Caron Coutier, Ben Stevenson ### Contact To report bugs, submit patches, ask for features or technical support, write [here](mailto:psimonprs@gmail.com).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
